intro: Torilis anthrisca, commonly known as field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Torilis anthrisca is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators.
